thread.title: Rewinding Will Muschamp reviews progress of Byron Cowart, areas for defense to improve
thread.title_full: Rewinding Will Muschamp reviews progress of Byron Cowart, areas for defense to improve | AL.com

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Rewinding Will Muschamp reviews progress of Byron Cowart, areas for defense to improve
text:
Auburn defensive coordinator Will Muschamp met with the media following Wednesday's practice.
Muschamp went over Auburn's 35-21 over San Jose State and assessed where the Tigers (3-2, 0-2 SEC) are defensively after five games.
Below is a quick update.
WILL MUSCHAMP
On what the defense is working on this week: Fundamentals, points of emphasis, shedding blocks, etc. "You need to address the things you're not doing well and we're just not playing well in the front seven." Calls front seven "very poor" with shedding blocks and has been "very disappointed" with "very inconsistent" progress on those topics Cassanova McKinzy "made some plays" in first start at Buck. "Everything was totally new" for him. Got some pressure 1-on-1. Tre' Williams and Tim Irvin (bone bruise, foot) are expected back at Kentucky Carlton Davis doing well. On TD he was beat on, not a lot Davis could do, was in position to make a play. On T.J. Davis: "Another guy that (could) be able to go in the fold." Byron Cowart is "playing very well" in ~20 snaps per game Says Cowart is someone who is very hard on himself and getting freshmen to understand they can play well without having production is always a challenge On another 400-yard performance: "Certainly not something I'm used to" and not something they want anyone to be accustomed to Jaun'tavius Johnson is closer to playing, considered a zero Says Devaroe Lawrence and Maurice Swain need to improve
